block.p: Penny Dee Liebman, a daughter of Nancy Liebman and Dr. Norman C. Liebman of Miami Beach, is to be married today to Mark Mordecai Aaron, the son of Carol A. Goldberg and Arthur Aaron Goldberg of New York. Rabbi Marc D. Angel is to perform the ceremony at Congregation Shearith Israel in New York.

The bride, 34, will continue to use her name professionally. She is an owner and director of the LiebmanMagnan Gallery in New York. She graduated from the University of Miami and received a master's degree in art history from Hunter College. Her father, who is retired, was a urologist in Miami and the chief of staff and chairman of surgery and urology at Parkway General Medical Center there. He is now a painter. Her mother is a Miami Beach city commissioner and an adviser to the National Trust for Historic Preservation.

Mr. Aaron, 33, changed his name. He is a filmmaker and voice-over actor in New York. He was a writer and director of ''America's First Synagogues,'' a documentary film. He graduated from Johns Hopkins University and received a certificate in film production from New York University. His mother is a contemporary-art consultant in New York. His father, a former general partner in Neuberger & Berman, a New York investment firm, is an investment adviser in New York. The bridegroom is the president of the archives committee and the men's club at Shearith Israel, where his father is an honorary trustee.
